resources.string:
Five Field Kono (오밭고누) is a Korean abstract strategy game. As in Chinese checkers, a player wins by moving all of their pieces into the starting positions of their opponent's pieces. Players take turns moving one of their pieces at a time one square diagonally forwards or backwards. The first player to move all of their pieces to their opponent's starting squares wins.

To move a piece, select it and then select the square you want to move it to.

Player scores can be observed under "Game Statistics".

START/RESTART button starts a new game.

PREFERENCES button opens the settings dialog. Changing the starting player takes effect only after starting a new game.
